body:
Comment 1: 
I've looked at the RFC and can't find any mention of using the '+' character as a
space. However, I have seen it used countless times in practice. (For example, try a
Google search with a space in it.) A quick survey of urlencode functions present in
other languages demonstrates they all convert spaces to '+'.

I'm inclined to leave this as it is. The set of services who would not accept '+'
must be tiny, and we shouldn't deviate from the expected behavior to satisfy them.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
